issue.title: Failing to build Target / does not exist

content.raw:
I don't expect this to particularly help, but one tweak I recommend making to your `CMakeLists.txt` is to change [this line](https://gist.github.com/tarunuday/d2b5961341096d10163788de7ded8bb8#file-vgazebo_plugins-cmakelists-txt-L34) to:

```
find_package(gazebo 9 REQUIRED)
```

to make sure that you have the desired version of Gazebo installed. I don't think this will affect anything in your case, but it's always better to be safe than confused.

I'm really struggling to think of a reason that this issue would be happening. I'm going to make some unconventional suggestions to help with debugging. Could you put the following lines into your `CMakeLists.txt` following [line 34](https://gist.github.com/tarunuday/d2b5961341096d10163788de7ded8bb8#file-vgazebo_plugins-cmakelists-txt-L34):

```
find_package(ignition-math4 REQUIRED)
find_package(ignition-cmake0 REQUIRED)
find_package(IgnProtobuf REQUIRED)
```

One thing I can say for sure is that I can make a dummy project using the exact `CMakeLists.txt` file that you provided, and run `catkin_make_isolated` and it works with no problem at all. I just created empty dummy files/directories for:

```
include/
src/Teleporter.cpp
src/vgazebo_ros_tricycle_drive.cpp
```

And then I made some minimally functional files for

```
package.xml
msg/Teleporter.msg
```

I'm using Ubuntu Bionic (18.04), ROS Melodic, Gazebo 9, and CMake 3.10.2. [Here's the output](https://gist.github.com/mxgrey/f9e3a5db16ef3f6e2386708552568208) from my `catkin_make_isolated` call for reference. I have to assume there's some kind of issue with the way packages are installed on your end, but even if that's the case I have a hard time comprehending how you'd get the particular set of issues that you're experiencing.

to make sure that you have the desired version of Gazebo installed. I don't think this will affect anything in your case, but it's always better to be safe than confused.

find_package(IgnProtobuf REQUIRED)
